body:
Comment 3: 
hi,

actually, now, on my mac development machine:
$ uname -a
Darwin macpro4.somewhere.net 10.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 10.6.0: Wed Nov 10 18:13:17
PST 2010; root:xnu-1504.9.26~3/RELEASE_I386 i386

with tip:
$ go version
go version devel +8bf13ae02c8e Mon Aug 19 16:22:33 2013 +1000 darwin/amd64

and with gcc-apple:
$ g++ --version
i686-apple-darwin10-g++-4.2.1 (GCC) 4.2.1 (Apple Inc. build 5646) (dot 1)
Copyright (C) 2007 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

none of the solutions work.
ie: with -lstdc++, or with -static-libstdc++ I get the SEGV from the original report.

-s
